avalancheActivity.comment: Isolated avalanches can be triggered in extremely steep terrain. Most releases are small. Risks of falls and injuries outweigh those of being buried in snow masses.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Not much snow. Low avalanche danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: The crust that forms at night - breakable-to-capable of bearing loads - softens up during the daytime on sunny slopes, remains hard-frozen on the surface in shady terrain. South-facing slopes are already bare of snow up to high altitudes. Little information is currently available to the Avalanche Warning Service from outlying terrain.

weatherForecast.comment: High-altitude clouds passing above summit level will intermittently hamper the sunshine. Temperatures are still quite mild, winds light. At 2000m: -2 to +3 degrees; at 3000m: -2 degrees. Generally light southerly to easterly winds at high altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment: In isolated cases avalanches can be triggered in persistent weak layers on very steep shady slopes. These releases are mostly small-sized. In addition, generally small-sized snowdrift accumulations have been generated at very high altitudes. The risks of falling and sustaining injuries outweigh those of being buried in snow masses.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Isolated avalanche prone locations in persistent weak layer of old snow.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack crust - breakable to capable-of-bearing-loads – which is generated during the nocturnal hours softens up during the daytime on sunny slopes, on shady slopes the snowpack surface often remains hard-frozen. Since there is hardly any transportable snow, strong-velocity southerly winds generated only small-sized local snowdrift accumulations. On shady slopes in high alpine regions, isolated weak layers occur inside the snowpack. South-facing slopes are bare of snow up to high altitudes. Only limited information is currently available to the Avalanche Warning Services from outlying terrain.

tendency.highlights: Avalanche danger expected to remain low

weatherForecast.comment: No significant change is anticipated, sunshine and high-altitude cloudbanks will provide pleasant mountain weather conditions. Temperatures will remain mild and southerly winds will be feelable only in the classic foehn lanes. Temperatures at 2000m: -1 to +4 degrees, at 3000m: -2 degrees. Light to moderate-velocity southerly winds at high altitudes, brisker in the foehn mountain ranges.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Low avalanche danger. Caution urged on very steep shady slopes in high alpine regions.
